titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Romanov family papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lyalya Kharitonova

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-12-13T14:05-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoirs, other writings, printed matter, photographs, and memorabilia relating to the Russian aristocracy and to Russian émigré affairs following the Russian Revolution.

origination.label: Creator
origination.persname: K. R. (Konstantin Romanov), Grand Duke of Russia, 1858-1915.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Closed. Microfilm use only. Boxes 56 and 59-65 were not filmed.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Romanov family papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2013.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Descendants of Grand Duke Konstantin Konstantinovich of Russia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Romanov family papers include writings, notes, clippings, printed matter, and photographs relating to various members of the Romanov family and other Russian dignitaries and nobility; events in Russia before, during, and after the Russian Revolution; Russian immigration to foreign countries; and the Russian Orthodox Church abroad. The bulk of the collection consists of extensive correspondence between family members and individuals connected closely with the Russian Imperial family relating to personal matters in the lives of the family. The collection also includes Romanov family memorabilia.

The papers consist primarily of materials collected by the descendants of Grand Duke Konstantin Konstantinovich of Russia, a grandson of Emperor Nicholas I of Russia. Materials were collected by the Bagration branch of the Romanov family and were donated to the Hoover Institution Archives by Grand Duke Konstantin Konstantinovich Romanov’s granddaughter-in-law Irina Bezobrazova-Bagration.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Statement
arrangement.p: Original arrangement of the collection into trunks, bags, and cartons has been retained. However, material within each storage trunk has been described in greater detail and arranged within each one, either by subject or physical form.
